intro: Heracleum isopetalum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cowparn, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. It is native to Central Asia and grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features a tall, slender stem with finely divided, feather-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbrella-like inflorescences, typical of the carrot family. Heracleum isopetalum is often found in alpine and steppe regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
